title: Madeleine Albright
summary: Madeleine Jana Korbel Albright[2] (born Marie Jana Korbelov√°; May 15, 1937)[3][4] is an American politician and diplomat who served as the 64th United States Secretary of State from 1997 to 2001 under President Bill Clinton.[5] She was the first female secretary of state in U.S. history.
